title: [Large-Scale] Instructional Design for Science Laboratory Classes Based on the Dick and Carey Model

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic scientific experimental procedures and mathematical measurement methods
context.additional_context: Students use individual experimental tools and interpret results through mathematical analysis. Digital data recording and sharing are possible in BYOD environments

learning_goals: Students can systematically design science laboratory lessons by applying the nine stages of the Dick and Carey model.
When designing laboratory lessons, learners can distinguish and execute phases such as learner analysis, goal setting, assessment tool development, and instructional strategy formulation.
Learners can analyze experimental results and write reports using mathematical measurement and graph interpretation skills.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
